en.sc1:
This is an Employee entity with unary 1:1 relationship [Married from] with itself
Each employee can mary one and only one of his colleagues
en.sc2: New column will be added to the Employee entity to represent the relationship [Married from] relationship
en.sc3: To avoid confusion between the Fks and PKs the FK name (Eid) will be substituted with new name (Partner) Note: 1-Partner field is the same as E-id and should be of the same data type 2-the value of partner field must be one of the existing employees in the coulmn of the PK E-ID
en.sc4: Assume that Employee Ahmed with $E-id=5$ Married from Employee mona with $E-id=3$ How to physically implement this relation using Partner forigen Key
en.sc5: Assume that Employee Adel with $E-id=2$ Married from Employee Layla with $E-id=9$ How to physically implement this relation using Partner forigen Key
en.sc6: Employee ahmed with $E-id=$$5$ works at project Plumbing with project id $P-id=$$B$
en.sc7: Employee morad with $E-id=4$ works at project sewage with project id $P-id=C$
en.sc8: Employee walid with $E-id=6$ works at project Plumbing with project id $P-id=B$
en.sc9: Employee adel with $E-id=2$ works at project sewage with project id $P-id=C$
en.sc10: Employee ali with $E-id=1$ works at project Plumbing with project id $P-id=B$
en.sc11: Employee khaled with $E-id=3$ works at project electricity with project id $P-id=A$
